intro: Euphrasia × hybrida, commonly known as the common eyebright, is a hybrid species within the genus Euphrasia, belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange, often with dark markings. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and meadows. Euphrasia × hybrida is known for its medicinal properties, having been traditionally used to treat eye ailments and respiratory conditions. Its rapid growth and ability to naturalize make it a common garden plant, though it can become invasive in certain areas.
